scripts.title: Dark Mode GUI
scripts.description: GUI with Windows 11 dark mode support using DllCall
scripts.code:
```cpp
#Requires AutoHotkey v2.0

class DarkModeGUI {
    static DWMWA_USE_IMMERSIVE_DARK_MODE := 20
    
    __New() {
        this.gui := Gui('+Resize', 'Dark Mode App')
        this.gui.BackColor := '0x1a1a1a'
        
        this.ApplyDarkMode(this.gui.Hwnd)
        
        this.gui.SetFont('s10 cWhite', 'Segoe UI')
        this.gui.AddText('w300', 'Dark mode enabled!')
        
        this.gui.AddButton('w100 BackgroundBlack', 'Click Me')
        this.gui.Show()
    }
    
    ApplyDarkMode(hwnd) {
        darkMode := 1
        DllCall('dwmapi\DwmSetWindowAttribute',
            'Ptr', hwnd,
            'Int', DarkModeGUI.DWMWA_USE_IMMERSIVE_DARK_MODE,
            'Int*', &darkMode,
            'Int', 4)
    }
}

app := DarkModeGUI()
```

scripts.title: Window Position Manager
scripts.description: Save and restore window positions
scripts.code:
```cpp
#Requires AutoHotkey v2.0

class WindowManager {
    static positions := Map()
    static configFile := A_ScriptDir '\window-positions.ini'
    
    static SaveCurrent() {
        hwnd := WinGetID('A')
        title := WinGetTitle(hwnd)
        processName := WinGetProcessName(hwnd)
        
        WinGetPos(&x, &y, &w, &h, hwnd)
        
        key := processName '_' StrReplace(title, '=', '')
        this.positions[key] := {x: x, y: y, w: w, h: h}
        
        IniWrite(x ',' y ',' w ',' h, this.configFile, 'Windows', key)
        ToolTip('Position saved for ' processName)
        SetTimer(() => ToolTip(), -2000)
    }
    
    static RestoreCurrent() {
        hwnd := WinGetID('A')
        title := WinGetTitle(hwnd)
        processName := WinGetProcessName(hwnd)
        
        key := processName '_' StrReplace(title, '=', '')
        
        if saved := IniRead(this.configFile, 'Windows', key, '') {
            parts := StrSplit(saved, ',')
            WinMove(parts[1], parts[2], parts[3], parts[4], hwnd)
            ToolTip('Position restored')
            SetTimer(() => ToolTip(), -2000)
        }
    }
    
    static CenterWindow() {
        hwnd := WinGetID('A')
        WinGetPos(, , &w, &h, hwnd)
        
        monInfo := this.GetMonitorInfo(hwnd)
        x := monInfo.x + (monInfo.w - w) // 2
        y := monInfo.y + (monInfo.h - h) // 2
        
        WinMove(x, y, , , hwnd)
    }
    
    static GetMonitorInfo(hwnd) {
        ; Get monitor containing window
        hMon := DllCall('MonitorFromWindow', 'Ptr', hwnd, 'UInt', 2, 'Ptr')
        
        monInfo := Buffer(40)
        NumPut('UInt', 40, monInfo)
        DllCall('GetMonitorInfo', 'Ptr', hMon, 'Ptr', monInfo)
        
        return {
            x: NumGet(monInfo, 4, 'Int'),
            y: NumGet(monInfo, 8, 'Int'),
            w: NumGet(monInfo, 12, 'Int') - NumGet(monInfo, 4, 'Int'),
            h: NumGet(monInfo, 16, 'Int') - NumGet(monInfo, 8, 'Int')
        }
    }
}

^+s::WindowManager.SaveCurrent()
^+r::WindowManager.RestoreCurrent()
^+c::WindowManager.CenterWindow()
```

scripts.title: AhkV2Jiggle
scripts.description: Keep your computer awake automatically. AhkV2Jiggle prevents screen locks during presentations, downloads, or long processes by simulating realistic user activity with randomized mouse movements and clicks. Built with AutoHotkey v2.0.
scripts.code:

scripts.title: x15-compensator
scripts.description: The X15 Compensator is a lightweight, system-tray utility written in AutoHotkey v2.0. It is designed specifically to solve the "reverse-scroll" jitter common in the EVGA X15 MMO Mouse. By implementing a time-based directional lock, the software filters out mechanical "bounces" from the encoder before they reach Windows.
